The Galaxy Nexus is a highly anticipated phone,<ref>{{cite web|last=Webster |first=Scott |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/8301-19736_7-20116674-251/leaked-galaxy-nexus-details-point-to-verizon-exclusivity/ |title=Leaked Galaxy Nexus details point to Verizon exclusivity | Android Atlas - CNET Reviews |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/ice-cream-sandwich-debuted-with-samsung-galaxy-nexus/2011/10/19/gIQALxeM0L_story.html |title=Ice Cream Sandwich debuted with Samsung Galaxy Nexus |publisher=The Washington Post |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5850411/rumor-galaxy-nexus-coming-to-verizon-november-10th-for-an-ouchie-300 |title=Rumor: Galaxy Nexus Coming to Verizon November 10th for an Ouchie $300 |publisher=Gizmodo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://newyork.ibtimes.com/articles/232581/20111017/galaxy-nexus-prime-ice-cream-sandwich-android.htm |title=Galaxy Nexus Prime & Ice Cream Sandwich Release, Price Leaked [VIDEO] - International Business Times |publisher=Newyork.ibtimes.com |date=2011-10-17 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=October 28, 2011 |  8:20 am |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/technology/2011/10/galaxy-nexus-release-uk.html |title=Galaxy Nexus releasing Nov. 17 - in the U.K. - latimes.com |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Zeman |first=Eric |url=http://www.informationweek.com/news/personal-tech/smart-phones/231900194 |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus: High-End Specs - Personal-tech - Smart Phones |publisher=Informationweek |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref> gathering mostly positive reviews.
+
The Galaxy Nexus is a highly anticipated phone,<ref>{{cite web|last=Webster |first=Scott |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/8301-19736_7-20116674-251/leaked-galaxy-nexus-details-point-to-verizon-exclusivity/ |title=Leaked Galaxy Nexus details point to Verizon exclusivity | Android Atlas - CNET Reviews |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/ice-cream-sandwich-debuted-with-samsung-galaxy-nexus/2011/10/19/gIQALxeM0L_story.html |title=Ice Cream Sandwich debuted with Samsung Galaxy Nexus |publisher=The Washington Post |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5850411/rumor-galaxy-nexus-coming-to-verizon-november-10th-for-an-ouchie-300 |title=Rumor: Galaxy Nexus Coming to Verizon November 10th for an Ouchie $300 |publisher=Gizmodo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://newyork.ibtimes.com/articles/232581/20111017/galaxy-nexus-prime-ice-cream-sandwich-android.htm |title=Galaxy Nexus Prime & Ice Cream Sandwich Release, Price Leaked [VIDEO] - International Business Times |publisher=Newyork.ibtimes.com |date=2011-10-17 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=October 28, 2011 |  8:20 am |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/technology/2011/10/galaxy-nexus-release-uk.html |title=Galaxy Nexus releasing Nov. 17 - in the U.K. - latimes.com |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Zeman |first=Eric |url=http://www.informationweek.com/news/personal-tech/smart-phones/231900194 |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus: High-End Specs - Personal-tech - Smart Phones |publisher=Informationweek |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref> gathering highly positive reviews.
According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever. Without question, this is easily the slickest, most polished version of Android yet"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-ice-cream-sandwich-android-4-0-a-hands-on-screenshot-g/ Google Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0): a hands-on screenshot gallery - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and that "The entire experience just felt polished. In a way, it's as if Android's growing a bit and maturing before our eyes", concluding with "Overall, we're thrilled with how the first [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|ICS]] handset has turned out. It's understated, sleek, beautiful and packs a display that's destined to drop jaws."<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on (video) - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever. Without question, this is easily the slickest, most polished version of Android yet"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-ice-cream-sandwich-android-4-0-a-hands-on-screenshot-g/ Google Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0): a hands-on screenshot gallery - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and that "The entire experience just felt polished. In a way, it's as if Android's growing a bit and maturing before our eyes", concluding with "Overall, we're thrilled with how the first [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|ICS]] handset has turned out. The GSMArena review concludes stating "The Galaxy Nexus is an impressive device on its own."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_nexus_hands_on-review-663p4.php |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus hands-on: First look |publisher=GSMArena.com |date=2011-10-19 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref>
The GSMArena review concludes stating "The Galaxy Nexus is an impressive device on its own."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_galaxy_nexus_hands_on-review-663p4.php |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus hands-on: First look |publisher=GSMArena.com |date=2011-10-19 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref>

Mobilesyrup review indicates "Like the Nexus S before it, the Galaxy Nexus is not the most powerful device on the market, but it doesnât matter. From our time with the device, we can safely say there is no going back. Every piece of Android hardware from this day on will be judged not on the speed of its processor or its pixel density but on whether it is running Ice Cream Sandwich. The Galaxy Nexus has a market lead so vast as to be a chasm; the experience is just that much better. While there are minor aspects of the hardware weâd love to see improved, Samsung has wisely taken the best design aspects of the Nexus S and Galaxy S II variants and created the first best Android device ever." <ref>{{citeweb|url=http://mobilesyrup.com/2011/11/17/galaxy-nexus-review-part-1-hardware-overview-video/|title=Galaxy Nexus Review Part 1: Hardware Overview (video)|publisher=mobilesyrup.com|date=2011-11-17|accessdate=2011-11-17}}</ref>
+
Mobilesyrup's review indicates "From our time with the device, we can safely say there is no going back. Every piece of Android hardware from this day on will be judged not on the speed of its processor or its pixel density but on whether it is running Ice Cream Sandwich. The Galaxy Nexus has a market lead so vast as to be a chasm; the experience is just that much better. [...] Samsung has wisely taken the best design aspects of the Nexus S and Galaxy S II variants and created the first best Android device ever." <ref>{{citeweb|url=http://mobilesyrup.com/2011/11/17/galaxy-nexus-review-part-1-hardware-overview-video/|title=Galaxy Nexus Review Part 1: Hardware Overview (video)|publisher=mobilesyrup.com|date=2011-11-17|accessdate=2011-11-17}}</ref>
